headline: Disney should shut down ABC, this analyst says. Here's why.
summary: Disney (DIS) should shut down ABC, Needham & Company senior media and internet analyst Laura Martin tells Yahoo Finance. The analyst call comes amid controversy over Disney suspending and reinstating late-night host Jimmy Kimmel on ABC and hiking streaming prices. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination.

headline: Disney+ hikes streaming prices despite lingering fallout over Kimmel suspension
summary: Disney is hiking streaming prices for the fourth straight year as it pushes to sustain profitability — even as the company faces backlash and boycott calls over its suspension and reinstatement of Jimmy Kimmel's late-night show.

raw.headline: Disney+ hikes streaming prices despite lingering fallout over Kimmel suspension
raw.summary: Disney is hiking streaming prices for the fourth straight year as it pushes to sustain profitability — even as the company faces backlash and boycott calls over its suspension and reinstatement of Jimmy Kimmel's late-night show.

headline: Disney+ to raise subscription prices for fourth consecutive year
summary: Starting October 21, the ad-supported Disney+ plan will increase by $2 to $11.99 per month, while the ad-free premium tier will rise $3 to $18.99 a month.  Bundled packages combining Disney+ with Hulu and ESPN+ will also see price hikes, according to the company's website.  Disney is facing heightened public scrutiny following the recent controversy over the temporary removal of Jimmy Kimmel Live!

Disney is facing heightened public scrutiny following the recent controversy over the temporary removal of Jimmy Kimmel Live!

headline: Disney is raising the price of Disney+, Hulu subscriptions next month
summary: The timing of the price increases isn’t ideal, as Disney+ subscribers canceled their subscriptions in droves last week, protesting Disney’s decision to temporarily pull Jimmy Kimmel from its airwaves.

headline: Disney says ‘Jimmy Kimmel Live!’ to return after backlash
summary: “We have spent the last days having thoughtful conversations with Jimmy, and after those conversations, we reached the decision to return the show on Tuesday,” ABC’s parent said in a statement.  Disney’s decision to suspend the show followed pressure from both the federal government and independent operators of ABC stations.

headline: Nexstar, Sinclair will not resume airing 'Jimmy Kimmel Live'
summary: WASHINGTON (Reuters) -Two major U.S. broadcast owners said they will not resume airing “Jimmy Kimmel Live!” on Tuesday on their ABC affiliates and will instead run other programming, after ABC parent Walt Disney announced on Monday that it will resume broadcasting the late-night talk show.  Nexstar Media and Sinclair Broadcasting said they will not resume airing the show on their 70 owned and partner ABC stations, which is more than 25% of the roughly 250 ABC affiliates nationwide.  "Discussions with ABC are ongoing as we evaluate the show’s potential return," Sinclair said.

raw.headline: Nexstar, Sinclair will not resume airing 'Jimmy Kimmel Live'
raw.summary: WASHINGTON (Reuters) -Two major U.S. broadcast owners said they will not resume airing “Jimmy Kimmel Live!” on Tuesday on their ABC affiliates and will instead run other programming, after ABC parent Walt Disney announced on Monday that it will resume broadcasting the late-night talk show.  Nexstar Media and Sinclair Broadcasting said they will not resume airing the show on their 70 owned and partner ABC stations, which is more than 25% of the roughly 250 ABC affiliates nationwide.  "Discussions with ABC are ongoing as we evaluate the show’s potential return," Sinclair said.

headline: Media companies have 'moral obligation' to uphold free speech
summary: Jimmy Kimmel will return to his ABC late night spot on Tuesday after facing backlash comments tied to the shooting death of conservative activist Charlie Kirk. ABC parent company Disney (DIS) was under pressure from broadcast providers and regulators, raising a larger question about what this moment means for the free speech of artists and major media networks. Plex CEO Keith Valory underlines the importance of media companies and streamers maintaining their independence and freedom of expression. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Catalysts.

headline: Should Disney shut down ABC? Needham’s Martin answers
summary: Investing.com -- Disney should consider shutting down its ABC broadcast network rather than selling it, according to Needham & Company, which argues the move could unlock long-term value despite a near-term hit.

raw.headline: Should Disney shut down ABC? Needham’s Martin answers
raw.summary: Investing.com -- Disney should consider shutting down its ABC broadcast network rather than selling it, according to Needham & Company, which argues the move could unlock long-term value despite a near-term hit.

headline: Disney should shut down ABC and transfer content to streaming, brokerage says
summary: (Reuters) -Walt Disney should shut down the ABC network rather than sell it and transfer the channel's content to its streaming platforms to lower regulatory risks and unlock higher valuation, brokerage Needham wrote in a client note on Tuesday.  The recent "FCC intervention has made owning broadcasting licenses too expensive and too volatile for Disney shareholders, in our view," the brokerage said.  Disney's decision to take Kimmel's show off the air last week added fuel to the debate of free speech in America amid conservative uproar around the late-night host's comments surrounding the assassination of right-wing activist Charlie Kirk.

Disney's decision to take Kimmel's show off the air last week added fuel to the debate of free speech in America amid conservative uproar around the late-night host's comments surrounding the assassination of right-wing activist Charlie Kirk.

headline: Rally cools, Fed's Powell, Kimmel returns to ABC: 3 Things
summary: US stock futures (ES=F, NQ=F, YM=F) are mostly flat Tuesday morning as the equity rally showed signs of cooling at Monday's session close. Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell is set to speak on the state of the US economy later today. ABC — which is owned by Disney (DIS) — late-night show "Jimmy Kimmel Live!" will return to air tonight, while Sinclair Broadcast Group (SBGI) plans to keep the show off its ABC affiliate stations. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Morning Brief.

headline: Morning Bid: Pain thresholds
summary: Markets are digesting mixed signals this morning: Wall Street cooled after hitting record highs, Asia is riding an AI-driven surge, and gold has smashed through $3,750 an ounce, as investors hedge against uncertainty.  * The S&P 500 and Nasdaq paused after hitting record highs, with the Dow down 0.21%, S&P 500 off 0.02%, and Nasdaq up 0.11%.  Apple surged 2.4% on strong iPhone 17 demand, while Tesla and Nvidia extended gains.
